topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces Nubank’s scale and word-of-mouth growth, plus Jag’s background across Nubank, Facebook, Google, and Quantcast, setting up the episode’s focus on product, strategy, and fintech.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor messages for WorkOS (enterprise features/authz) and Mercury (startup banking and bill pay/accounting capabilities).

topics.title: Nubank mind-blowing stats and word of mouth
topics.summary: Lenny shares Nubank’s comparative size, customer count, and viral growth; Jag adds brand stunts/records, reinforcing how unusual Nubank’s organic growth is for banking.

topics.title: Building products customers love fanatically
topics.summary: Jag explains Nubank’s foundations: targeting deep emotional pain points with incumbents, embedding customer love into culture, and using discovery/observation plus rapid iteration to earn advocacy.

topics.title: Company values and operationalizing customer obsession
topics.summary: Jag lists Nubank’s five values and describes mechanisms like Amazon-style PR/FAQ writing and frequent product/design reviews to test whether work is truly “fundamentally different” for customers.

topics.title: Measuring love: Sean Ellis score, NPS, churn
topics.summary: Jag details Nubank’s gating metrics: Sean Ellis ‘very disappointed’ score (with a higher bar in Brazil), world-class NPS targets, and churn/leaky-bucket focus to sustain word-of-mouth loops.

topics.title: Using cohorts to raise product-market-fit scores
topics.summary: They discuss diagnosing why scores are low, finding ‘bullseye’ cohorts where love is high, and iterating toward ‘great enough’—with examples like bill-pay automation and Ultravioleta card benefits.

topics.title: Direct customer calls and fast feedback loops
topics.summary: Jag advocates PMs/designers personally calling ~10 customers to capture nuance and speed learning, minimizing research distance and using qualitative signal to guide iteration.

topics.title: PM courage: pushing back and not scaling problems
topics.summary: Jag explains why PMs must say no under pressure, avoid ‘bouncing a dead cat’ with forced distribution, and rely on ownership culture plus clarity/data to prevent scaling small issues into big messes.

topics.title: Doing customer research well: hypotheses and observation
topics.summary: Jag shares pitfalls and best practices: start with a crisp hypothesis, don’t become a lawyer for it, prefer observation and indirect questions, and keep anecdotes central alongside analysis.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor message for OneSchema, an embeddable CSV importer that handles messy data and reduces engineering/support burden.

topics.title: Strategy: clarity, focus, and coherent bets
topics.summary: Jag argues strategy is not aspiration but a coherent plan; he cites Kevin Systrom’s ‘at least we are clear,’ references Rumelt, and explains Nubank’s early focused wedge and why concentrated bets beat hedging.

topics.title: Building strategic muscle and being fundamentally different
topics.summary: Jag recommends taking strategy seriously, using frameworks (Rumelt, Roger Martin, category design), and practicing courageous focus; he reiterates Nubank’s mantra of being fundamentally different, not incrementally better.
